data.title: U.S. Army Garrison-Miami Directorate of Human Resources
data.text:
Army Promotion Boards are held monthly by the element SGM.

Retirements/Transition Assistance

Retirement Services and Transition Assistance for USSOUTHCOM service members are located in the U.S. Army Garrison-Miami Human Resources Directorate, and provided by the Military Personnel Office (MILPO).

Once a retiring service member obtains his/her retirement orders, it is imperative to contact the Retirement Services Officer at (305)437-1717 to schedule an appointment for their Retirement/Survivor Benefit Plan (SBP) briefing.

Service members that require DD 214s need to schedule an appointment with the MPD by calling (305) 437-0739/1715/1717/1936

The Soldier for Life â€” Transition Assistance Program (SFL-TAP)

Available at (305)437-1717, is a centrally funded commanders program that provides transition assistance services to eligible Soldiers.

Transition Eligibility

All Soldiers that complete 180 days or more of continuous Active Duty are eligible for and must complete transition services with few exceptions.

Retirees will maintain eligibility for life. Non-Retirees will remain eligible for 180 days after their separation date.

Family Member of Military Service Member. Family members of Soldiers are eligible for transition services and highly encouraged to attend if their spouse is the eligible Soldier. Family members of Other Uniformed Services (Marines, Navy, Air Force, Coast Guard), receive services up to 180 days after your sponsor's retirement date. Family members of a Non-Retired Veteran, receive services up to 180 days after your sponsor's separation date.

Signing In and Off of Leave

As there is no Staff Duty here at USSOUTHCOM/USAG-Miami, service members will be signed in and off of leave the day they arrive at the Military Personnel Services.

Finance Services

The MPD is the liaison between the service member and MacDill AFB APPC / AMPO. All personnel and some finance actions are processed through MacDill Air Force Base.
